titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Dr. Selwyn S. Roback (1924-1988) was an entomologist and curator of limnology at the Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia. He joined the Academy in 1951 as an assistant curator and became a full curator in 1963. He was a specialist in non-biting aquatic midges. In the Department of Limnology, Roback studied the taxonomy and ecology of aquatic insects, particularly in the immature stages, collected as part of the Academy's limnological studies. Roback also participated in several Academy expeditions, including those to Peru in 1955, Colombia in 1955, and Peru and Bolivia in 1977.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers of Selwyn S. Roback. Materials in the collection include: correspondence with H.Radclyffe Roberts and other colleagues; papers by Roback, including drafts of articles and talks; proposals, reports, and receipts for expeditions; slides and photos of expeditions in Peru, Bolivia, and Columbia; notes from professional meetings; several reprints; photocopied maps; illustrations and photographic mockups; a collection of autographs of scientists; and portraits and prints of entomologists. The collection also includes illustrations of insects, fish, shells, mollusks, and butterflies by various people, including H.A. Pilsbry, Helen Winchester, J.A.G. Rehn, and H.W. Fowler. Illustrations are black and white and handcolored prints and original ink and pencil drawings and watercolors. Additionally the collection contains 11 woodcuts (1967-1973) by Roback of various subjects including birds, fish and insects.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
